statements.name: PROC SGPLOT
statements.description: Identifies the data set that contains the plot variables. The statement also gives you the option to specify a description, write template code to a file, control the uniformity of axes, and control automatic legends and automatic attributes.

arguments.name: ASPECT=
arguments.description: specifies the aspect ratio of the plot’s wall area.

arguments.name: CYCLEATTRS
arguments.description: specifies whether plots are drawn with unique attributes in the graph.

arguments.name: NOCYCLEATTRS
arguments.description: specifies whether plots are drawn with unique attributes in the graph.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies the SAS data set that contains the variables to process.

arguments.name: DATTRMAP=
arguments.description: specifies the discrete attribute map data set that you want to use with the procedure.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: specifies a description for the output image.

arguments.name: NOAUTOLEGEND
arguments.description: disables automatic legends from being generated.

arguments.name: NOBORDER
arguments.description: turns off the display of the graph wall border.

arguments.name: NOSUBPIXEL
arguments.description: specifies whether subpixel rendering should be used for rendering plots and charts.

arguments.name: SUBPIXEL
arguments.description: specifies whether subpixel rendering should be used for rendering plots and charts.

arguments.name: NOWALL
arguments.description: turns off the display of the graph wall’s fill.

arguments.name: OPAQUE
arguments.description: specifies whether the graph background is opaque or transparent.

arguments.name: NOOPAQUE
arguments.description: specifies whether the graph background is opaque or transparent.

arguments.name: PAD=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of extra space to add to the left, right, top, and bottom of the graph.

arguments.name: LEFT=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of extra space to add to the left edge.

arguments.name: RIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of extra space to add to the right edge.

arguments.name: TOP=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of extra space to add to the top edge.

arguments.name: BOTTOM=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of extra space to add to the bottom edge.

arguments.name: PCTLEVEL=
arguments.description: specifies the scope of graph data that is calculated in percentages.

arguments.name: BY
arguments.description: the percentages within each BY-group round up to 100%

arguments.name: GRAPH
arguments.description: the percentages across the entire graph round up to 100%

arguments.name: GROUP
arguments.description: the percentages across groups within a category round up to 100%.

arguments.name: PCTNDEC=
arguments.description: specifies the number of decimal spaces to be used to calculate the percent values.

arguments.name: RATTRMAP=
arguments.description: specifies the range attribute map data set that you want to use with the procedure.

arguments.name: SGANNO=
arguments.description: specifies the SG annotation data set that you want to use.

arguments.name: TMPLOUT=
arguments.description: writes the Graph Template Language code for your graph to a file.

arguments.name: UNIFORM=
arguments.description: specifies how to control axis scaling and legends when you use a BY statement.
arguments.help: UNIFORM=GROUP | SCALE | ALL | XSCALE | YSCALE | XSCALEGROUP | YSCALEGROUP

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: specifies that both the legend group values and the axis scaling are common among all of the levels of the BY variable or variables.

arguments.name: GROUP
arguments.description: specifies that each group value in the legend uses the same visual attributes across all levels of the BY variable or variables.

arguments.name: SCALE
arguments.description: specifies that the axis scaling is shared among all of the levels of the BY variable or variables.

arguments.name: XSCALE
arguments.description: specifies that the X-axis scaling is shared among all of the levels of the BY variable or variables.

arguments.name: YSCALE
arguments.description: specifies that the Y-axis scaling is shared among all of the levels of the BY variable or variables.

arguments.name: XSCALEGROUP
arguments.description: specifies that both the legend group values and the X-axis scaling are shared among all of the levels of the BY variable or variables.

arguments.name: YSCALEGROUP
arguments.description: specifies that both the legend group values and the Y-axis scaling are shared among all of the levels of the BY variable or variables.

statements.name: STYLEATTRS
statements.description: Specifies attributes for a graph. The statement enables you to change colors, markers, and so on, within the procedure, without having to change the ODS style template.

arguments.name: AXISBREAK=
arguments.description: specifies a symbol to use on the axis lines to indicate a break in the axis.
arguments.help: AXISBREAK=BRACKET | NOTCH | SLANTEDLEFT | SLANTEDRIGHT | SQUIGGLE | SPARK | Z

arguments.name: AXISEXTENT=
arguments.description: specifies the extent of the axis line for all axes.

arguments.name: FULL
arguments.description: the axis lines extend along the entire length of the axis.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: the axis lines extend through the data range from the minimum offset to the maximum offset.

arguments.name: BACKCOLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the background color of the graph area.

arguments.name: DATACOLORS=
arguments.description: specifies the fill colors for the graphics elements.

arguments.name: DATACONTRASTCOLORS=
arguments.description: specifies the contrast colors for the graphics elements, such as lines and markers.

arguments.name: DATAFILLPATTERNS=
arguments.description: specifies the list of graph fill patterns.

arguments.name: fill-pattern-list
arguments.description: a space-separated list of fill patterns, enclosed in parentheses.

arguments.name: DATALINEPATTERNS=
arguments.description: specifies the list of line patterns for the graph data lines.

arguments.name: DATASYMBOLS=
arguments.description: specifies the list of marker symbols for the graph data.

arguments.name: WALLCOLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the color of the plot wall area.

statements.name: BAND
statements.description: Creates a band that highlights part of a plot.
statements.help:
BAND  X=variable |  Y=variable |  
	 UPPER=numeric-value  |  numeric-variable 
	LOWER=numeric-valuenumeric-variable
	 </option(s)>;

arguments.name: X=
arguments.description: specifies a variable that is used to plot the band along the X or Y axis.

arguments.name: Y=
arguments.description: specifies a variable that is used to plot the band along the X or Y axis.

arguments.name: LOWER=
arguments.description: specifies the lower value for the band.

arguments.name: UPPER=
arguments.description: specifies the upper value for the band.

arguments.name: ATTRID=
arguments.description: specifies the value of the ID variable in a discrete attribute map data set.

arguments.name: CURVELABELATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the labels in the plot when you specify a curve label.

arguments.name: CURVELABELLOC=
arguments.description: specifies whether the curve label is placed inside the plot axes (INSIDE) or outside of the plot axes (OUTSIDE).

arguments.name: CURVELABELLOWER=
arguments.description: adds a label to the lower edge of the band.

arguments.name: CURVELABELPOS=
arguments.description: specifies the location of the curve label.

arguments.name: AUTO
arguments.description: places the curve label outside the plot area near the end of the curve along unused axes whenever possible (typically Y2 or X2).

arguments.name: MIN
arguments.description: places the label at the part of the curve closest to the minimum X-axis value.

arguments.name: MAX
arguments.description: places the label at the part of the curve closest to the maximum X-axis value.

arguments.name: START
arguments.description: places the curve label at the first point on the curve.

arguments.name: END
arguments.description: places the curve label at the last point on the curve.

arguments.name: CURVELABELUPPER=
arguments.description: adds a label to the upper edge of the band.

arguments.name: FILL
arguments.description: specifies whether the area fill is visible.

arguments.name: NOFILL
arguments.description: specifies whether the area fill is visible.

arguments.name: FILLATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the fill color and transparency.

arguments.name: FILLPATTERN
arguments.description: enables the display of line fill patterns for the plot.

arguments.name: FILLPATTERNATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the line-fill color and pattern.

arguments.name: style-element
arguments.description: specifies the name of a style element.

arguments.name: COLOR=
arguments.description: specifies a color to use for the fill lines.

arguments.name: PATTERN=
arguments.description: specifies the type of line pattern to use for the fill.

arguments.name: GROUP=
arguments.description: specifies a variable that is used to group the data.

arguments.name: LEGENDLABEL=
arguments.description: specifies a label that identifies the elements from the band plot in the legend.

arguments.name: LINEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the outlines for the band.

arguments.name: MODELNAME=
arguments.description: specifies the name of a plot that is used as a model for the interpolation for the band.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: assigns a name to a plot statement.

arguments.name: NOEXTEND
arguments.description: specifies that the band does not extend beyond the first and last data points in the plot.

arguments.name: NOMISSINGGROUP
arguments.description: specifies that missing values of the group variable are not included in the plot.

arguments.name: OUTLINE
arguments.description: specifies whether the outlines of the band are visible.

arguments.name: NOOUTLINE
arguments.description: specifies whether the outlines of the band are visible.

arguments.name: SPLITCHAR=
arguments.description: specifies one or more characters on which the text used for curve labels is always split.

arguments.name: SPLITCHARNODROP
arguments.description: specifies that the split characters are included in the displayed value.

arguments.name: SPLITJUSTIFY=
arguments.description: specifies the horizontal alignment of the value text that is being split.

arguments.name: TIP=
arguments.description: specifies the data tip information to be displayed when the cursor is positioned over the graphics element.

arguments.name: (variable-list)
arguments.description: a space-separated list of variables enclosed in parentheses.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: suppresses the data tips from this plot.

arguments.name: TIPFORMAT=
arguments.description: applies formats to the list of data tip variables that you specify in the TIP= option.

arguments.name: TIPLABEL=
arguments.description: applies labels to the list of data tip variables that you specify in the TIP= option.

arguments.name: TRANSPARENCY=
arguments.description: specifies the degree of transparency for the plot.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies how the data points for the lower and upper band boundaries are connected.

arguments.name: SERIES
arguments.description: the data points are connected directly using line segments, as in a series plot.

arguments.name: STEP
arguments.description: the data points are connected using a step function, as in a step plot.

arguments.name: X2AXIS
arguments.description: assigns the variable that is assigned to the primary (bottom) horizontal axis to the secondary (top) horizontal axis.

arguments.name: Y2AXIS
arguments.description: assigns the variable that is assigned to the primary (left) vertical axis to the secondary (right) vertical axis.

statements.name: BLOCK
statements.description: Creates one or more rectangular blocks containing text values. The block widths are determined by a specified block variable.

arguments.name: X=
arguments.description: specifies X-axis positions.

arguments.name: BLOCK=
arguments.description: specifies the variable that classifies the observations into distinct subsets.

arguments.name: ALTFILLATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of alternate fills for the blocks.

arguments.name: ATTRID=
arguments.description: specifies the value of the ID variable in a discrete attribute map data set.

arguments.name: BLOCKLABEL=
arguments.description: specifies a column to use for alternative text in the blocks.

arguments.name: CLASS=
arguments.description: creates a stack of block plots, with one block plot for each unique value of the specified variable.

arguments.name: EXTENDMISSING
arguments.description: extends the previous block value if the current value is missing.

arguments.name: FILL
arguments.description: specifies whether the blocks are filled.

arguments.name: NOFILL
arguments.description: specifies whether the blocks are filled.

arguments.name: FILLATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the fill for the blocks.

arguments.name: FILLTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies how the blocks are filled.

arguments.name: MULTICOLOR
arguments.description: Blocks are filled with the COLOR attribute of the GraphData1–GraphDatan style elements.

arguments.name: ALTERNATE
arguments.description: Blocks are filled alternating between the colors specified by the FILLATTRS= and ALTFILLATTRS= options.

arguments.name: LABEL
arguments.description: specifies an external label for a single block plot.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: specifies an external label for a single block plot.

arguments.name: NOLABEL
arguments.description: specifies an external label for a single block plot.

arguments.name: LABELATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the color and font attributes of the external block label(s).

arguments.name: LABELPOS=
arguments.description: specifies the position for the block label for a single block plot.

arguments.name: LINEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the block outlines.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: assigns a name to a plot statement.

arguments.name: NOMISSINGCLASS
arguments.description: suppresses blocks that correspond to missing values of the CLASS= value.

arguments.name: OUTLINE
arguments.description: specifies whether the blocks have outlines.

arguments.name: NOOUTLINE
arguments.description: specifies whether the blocks have outlines.

arguments.name: NOVALUES
arguments.description: specifies whether the block values are displayed or hidden.

arguments.name: VALUES
arguments.description: specifies whether the block values are displayed or hidden.

arguments.name: POSITION=
arguments.description: positions the block plot at the bottom, center, or top of the graph.

arguments.name: SPLITCHAR=
arguments.description: specifies one or more characters on which the block text values are split according to the fit policy that is in effect.

arguments.name: SPLITCHARNODROP
arguments.description: specifies that the split characters are included in the displayed value.

arguments.name: TRANSPARENCY=
arguments.description: specifies the degree of transparency for the blocks.

arguments.name: VALUEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the block text values.

arguments.name: VALUEFITPOLICY=
arguments.description: specifies how text values are adjusted to fit within the containing block.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No attempt is made to fit values that collide with the text values in adjacent blocks.

arguments.name: SHRINK
arguments.description: All values are reduced in font size until they all fit.

arguments.name: SPLIT
arguments.description: If a value does not fit within the containing block, it is split at a split character.

arguments.name: SPLITALWAYS
arguments.description: Text values are split at a split character in all blocks.

arguments.name: TRUNCATE
arguments.description: Any value that does not fit is truncated.

arguments.name: VALUEHALIGN=
arguments.description: specifies the horizontal alignment of the value text within the blocks.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: left-aligned within the block

arguments.name: CENTER
arguments.description: center-aligned within the block

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: right-aligned within the block

arguments.name: START
arguments.description: center-aligned at the starting value of the block

arguments.name: VALUEVALIGN=
arguments.description: specifies the vertical alignment of the value text within the blocks.

arguments.name: X2AXIS
arguments.description: assigns the X variable to the secondary (top) horizontal axis.

statements.name: BUBBLE
statements.description: Creates a bubble plot in which two variables determine the location of the bubble centers and a third variable controls the size of the bubble.

arguments.name: X=
arguments.description: specifies the variable for the X axis.

arguments.name: Y=
arguments.description: specifies the variable for the Y axis.

arguments.name: SIZE=
arguments.description: specifies the variable that controls the size of the bubbles.

arguments.name: ABSSCALE
arguments.description: specifies that the SIZE= column values are interpreted in the same units as the axes rather than as relative values.

arguments.name: ATTRID=
arguments.description: specifies the value of the ID variable in a discrete attribute map data set.

arguments.name: BRADIUSMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the size of the radius of the largest bubble.

arguments.name: BRADIUSMIN=
arguments.description: specifies the size of the radius of the smallest bubble.

arguments.name: COLORMODEL=
arguments.description: specifies a color ramp that is to be used to determine response colors.

arguments.name: style-element
arguments.description: specifies the name of a style element.

arguments.name: (color-list)
arguments.description: specifies a space-separated list of colors to use in the color ramp.

arguments.name: COLORRESPONSE=
arguments.description: specifies the numeric column that is used to map colors to a continuous color ramp.

arguments.name: DATALABEL
arguments.description: displays a label for each data point.

arguments.name: DATALABEL=
arguments.description: displays a label for each data point.

arguments.name: DATALABELATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the labels in the plot when you use the DATALABEL= option.

arguments.name: DATALABELPOS=
arguments.description: specifies the location of each data label with respect to its data point.

arguments.name: DATASKIN=
arguments.description: specifies a special effect to be used on the plot.
arguments.help: DATASKIN=NONE | CRISP | GLOSS | MATTE | PRESSED | SHEEN

arguments.name: DRAWORDER=
arguments.description: specifies whether the bubbles are drawn according to bubble size or according to data order.

arguments.name: SIZE
arguments.description: draws the bubbles according to bubble size, from the largest to the smallest.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: draws the bubbles according to data order.

arguments.name: FILL
arguments.description: specifies whether the bubbles are filled.

arguments.name: NOFILL
arguments.description: specifies whether the bubbles are filled.

arguments.name: FILLATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the fill color and transparency.

arguments.name: FILLPATTERN
arguments.description: enables the display of line fill patterns for the plot.

arguments.name: FILLPATTERNATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the line-fill color and pattern.

arguments.name: style-element
arguments.description: specifies the name of a style element.

arguments.name: COLOR=
arguments.description: specifies a color to use for the fill lines.

arguments.name: PATTERN=
arguments.description: specifies the type of line pattern to use for the fill.

arguments.name: GROUP=
arguments.description: specifies a variable that is used to group the data.

arguments.name: LEGENDLABEL=
arguments.description: specifies the label that identifies the bubble plot in the legend.

arguments.name: LINEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the outlines for the bubbles.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: assigns a name to a plot statement.

arguments.name: NOMISSINGGROUP
arguments.description: specifies that missing values of the group variable are not included in the plot.

arguments.name: OUTLINE
arguments.description: specifies whether the outlines of the bubbles are visible.

arguments.name: NOOUTLINE
arguments.description: specifies whether the outlines of the bubbles are visible.

arguments.name: PROPORTIONAL
arguments.description: specifies that proportional scaling be applied to the SIZE= column values.

arguments.name: RATTRID=
arguments.description: specifies the value of the ID variable in a range attribute map data set.

arguments.name: SPLITCHAR=
arguments.description: specifies one or more characters on which the text for data labels is always split.

arguments.name: SPLITCHARNODROP
arguments.description: specifies that the split characters are included in the displayed value.

arguments.name: SPLITJUSTIFY=
arguments.description: specifies the horizontal alignment of the value text that is being split.

arguments.name: TIP=
arguments.description: specifies the data tip information to be displayed when the cursor is positioned over the graphics element.

arguments.name: (variable-list)
arguments.description: a space-separated list of variables enclosed in parentheses.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: suppresses the data tips from this plot.

arguments.name: TIPFORMAT=
arguments.description: applies formats to the list of data tip variables that you specify in the TIP= option.

arguments.name: TIPLABEL=
arguments.description: applies labels to the list of data tip variables that you specify in the TIP= option.

arguments.name: TRANSPARENCY=
arguments.description: specifies the degree of transparency for the plot.

arguments.name: URL=
arguments.description: specifies an HTML page to be displayed when parts of the plot are selected.

arguments.name: character-variable
arguments.description: specifies a variable that contains a valid HTML page reference (HREF) for each plot element that is to have an active link.

arguments.name: X2AXIS
arguments.description: assigns the variables that are assigned to the primary (bottom) horizontal axis to the secondary (top) horizontal axis.

arguments.name: Y2AXIS
arguments.description: assigns the variables that are assigned to the primary (left) vertical axis to the secondary (right) vertical axis.

statements.name: DENSITY
statements.description: Creates a density curve that shows the distribution of values for a numeric variable.

arguments.name: response-variable
arguments.description: specifies the variable for the X axis.

arguments.name: ATTRID=
arguments.description: specifies the value of the ID variable in a discrete attribute map data set.

arguments.name: CURVELABEL=
arguments.description: adds a label for the density curve.

arguments.name: CURVELABELATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the labels in the plot when you use the CURVELABEL= option.

arguments.name: CURVELABELLOC=
arguments.description: specifies whether the curve label is placed inside the plot axes (INSIDE) or outside of the plot axes (OUTSIDE).

arguments.name: CURVELABELPOS=
arguments.description: specifies the location of the curve label.

arguments.name: AUTO
arguments.description: places the curve label outside the plot area near the end of the curve along unused axes whenever possible (typically Y2 or X2).

arguments.name: END
arguments.description: places the curve label at the last point on the curve.

arguments.name: MAX
arguments.description: places the label at the part of the curve closest to the maximum X-axis value.

arguments.name: MIN
arguments.description: places the label at the part of the curve closest to the minimum X-axis value.

arguments.name: START
arguments.description: places the curve label at the first point on the curve.

arguments.name: FREQ=
arguments.description: specifies a variable for the frequency count for each observation in the input data.

arguments.name: GROUP=
arguments.description: specifies a variable that is used to group the data.

arguments.name: LEGENDLABEL=
arguments.description: specifies a label that identifies the density plot in the legend.

arguments.name: LINEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the density line.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: assigns a name to a plot statement.

arguments.name: SCALE=
arguments.description: specifies the scaling that is used for the response axis.

arguments.name: COUNT
arguments.description: the axis displays the frequency count.

arguments.name: DENSITY
arguments.description: the axis displays the density estimate values.

arguments.name: PERCENT
arguments.description: the axis displays values as a percentage of the total.

arguments.name: PROPORTION
arguments.description: the axis displays values in proportion to the total.

arguments.name: SPLITCHAR=
arguments.description: specifies one or more characters on which the text for curve labels is always split.

arguments.name: SPLITCHARNODROP
arguments.description: specifies that the split characters are included in the displayed value.

arguments.name: SPLITJUSTIFY=
arguments.description: specifies the horizontal alignment of the value text that is being split.

arguments.name: TRANSPARENCY=
arguments.description: specifies the degree of transparency for the plot.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of distribution curve that is used for the density plot.

arguments.name: NORMAL
arguments.description: specifies a normal density estimate, with a mean and a standard deviation.

arguments.name: MU=
arguments.description: specifies the mean value that is used in the density function equation.

arguments.name: SIGMA=
arguments.description: specifies the standard deviation value that is used in the density function equation.

arguments.name: KERNEL
arguments.description: specifies a nonparametric kernel density estimate.

arguments.name: C=
arguments.description: specifies the standardized bandwidth for a number that is greater than 0 and less than or equal to 100.

arguments.name: WEIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the weight function.

arguments.name: WEIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies a variable that contains values to be used as weights for the calculations.

arguments.name: X2AXIS
arguments.description: assigns the X variable to the secondary (top) horizontal axis.

arguments.name: Y2AXIS
arguments.description: assigns the calculated result to the secondary (right) vertical axis.

statements.name: DOT
statements.description: Creates a dot plot that summarizes the values of a category variable.

arguments.name: category-variable
arguments.description: specifies the variable whose values determine the categories of data represented by the dots.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies the confidence level for the confidence limits.

arguments.name: ATTRID=
arguments.description: specifies the value of the ID variable in a discrete attribute map data set.

arguments.name: CATEGORYORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the order in which the categories are arranged.

arguments.name: RESPASC
arguments.description: sorts by the response values in ascending order.

arguments.name: RESPDESC
arguments.description: sorts by the response values in descending order.

arguments.name: CLUSTERWIDTH=
arguments.description: specifies the width of the group clusters as a fraction of the midpoint spacing.

arguments.name: COLORMODEL=
arguments.description: specifies a color ramp that is to be used to determine response colors.

arguments.name: style-element
arguments.description: specifies the name of a style element.

arguments.name: (color-list)
arguments.description: specifies a space-separated list of colors to use in the color ramp.

arguments.name: COLORRESPONSE=
arguments.description: specifies the numeric column that is used to map colors to a continuous color ramp.

arguments.name: COLORSTAT=
arguments.description: specifies the statistic to use for computing the response colors.

arguments.name: FREQ
arguments.description: frequency count

arguments.name: PCT
arguments.description: percentages between 0 and 100

arguments.name: SUM
arguments.description: sum values for the color response

arguments.name: MEAN
arguments.description: mean values for the color response

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: median values for the color response

arguments.name: DATALABEL
arguments.description: displays a label for each data point.

arguments.name: DATALABEL=
arguments.description: displays a label for each data point.

arguments.name: DATALABELATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the labels in the plot when you use the DATALABEL= option.

arguments.name: DATALABELPOS=
arguments.description: specifies the location of the data label.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: places the label on the data primitives (at the right edge of the dots).

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: places the label to the left of the dots on the left edge of the data area.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: places the label to the right of the dots on the right edge of the data area.

arguments.name: DATASKIN=
arguments.description: specifies a special effect to be used on the plot.
arguments.help: DATASKIN=NONE | CRISP | GLOSS | MATTE | PRESSED | SHEEN

arguments.name: DISCRETEOFFSET=
arguments.description: specifies an amount to offset all dots from discrete category values.

arguments.name: FILLEDOUTLINEDMARKERS
arguments.description: specifies that markers have a fill and an outline.

arguments.name: FREQ=
arguments.description: specifies a variable for the frequency count for each observation in the input data.

arguments.name: GROUP=
arguments.description: specifies a variable that is used to group the data.

arguments.name: GROUPDISPLAY=
arguments.description: specifies how to display grouped dots.

arguments.name: CLUSTER
arguments.description: grouped items are drawn adjacent to each other.

arguments.name: OVERLAY
arguments.description: grouped items are drawn at the exact coordinate and might overlap.

arguments.name: GROUPORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the ordering of the groups within a category.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: orders the groups within a category in data order of the group variable.

arguments.name: REVERSEDATA
arguments.description: orders the groups within a category in the reverse data order of the group variable.

arguments.name: ASCENDING
arguments.description: orders the groups within a category in ascending order of the group variable.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: orders the groups within a category in descending order of the group variable.

arguments.name: LEGENDLABEL=
arguments.description: specifies the label that identifies the dot plot in the legend.

arguments.name: LIMITATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the limit lines in the plot.

arguments.name: LIMITCAPSCALE=
arguments.description: specifies a positive number to use as a multiplier for changing the default width of the limit-bar cap (serif).

arguments.name: LIMITS=
arguments.description: specifies which limit lines to display.

arguments.name: BOTH
arguments.description: adds lower and upper limit lines to the plot.

arguments.name: LOWER
arguments.description: adds lower limit lines to the plot.

arguments.name: UPPER
arguments.description: adds upper limit lines to the plot.

arguments.name: LIMITSTAT=
arguments.description: specifies the statistic for the limit lines.

arguments.name: CLM
arguments.description: confidence limits

arguments.name: STDDEV
arguments.description: standard deviation

arguments.name: STDERR
arguments.description: standard error

arguments.name: MARKERATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the markers in the plot.

arguments.name: MARKERFILLATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the color of the marker fill.

arguments.name: MARKEROUTLINEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the marker outlines.

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: accepts a missing value as a valid category value.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: assigns a name to a plot statement.

arguments.name: NOLIMITCAPS
arguments.description: suppresses the serif cap on limit lines, if limit lines are displayed.

statements.name: SYMBOLCHAR
statements.description: Defines a marker symbol using a Unicode character that can be referenced in other statements. The procedure can contain more than one SYMBOLCHAR statement.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies a unique identifier for the marker symbol.

arguments.name: CHAR=
arguments.description: specifies a glyph (character) to be used as the marker symbol.

arguments.name: ""x
arguments.description: specifies a four-byte hexadecimal constant, such as '03c3'x, that represents a Unicode character in the current font.

arguments.name: keyword
arguments.description: specifies a SAS keyword for a Unicode character, such as alpha or alpha_u.

arguments.name: HOFFSET=
arguments.description: specifies a horizontal offset for the marker symbol.

arguments.name: ROTATE=
arguments.description: specifies the angle of rotation for the marker symbol in degrees.

arguments.name: SCALE=
arguments.description: specifies a scale factor for the marker symbol as a percentage.

arguments.name: TEXTATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the text attributes for the character symbol.

arguments.name: VOFFSET=
arguments.description: specifies a vertical offset for the marker symbol.

statements.name: SYMBOLIMAGE
statements.description: Defines a marker symbol using an image. The marker symbol can then be referenced in other statements.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies a unique identifier for the marker symbol.

arguments.name: IMAGE=
arguments.description: specifies the name and location of the image file.

arguments.name: HOFFSET=
arguments.description: specifies a horizontal offset for the marker symbol.

arguments.name: ROTATE=
arguments.description: specifies the angle of rotation for the marker symbol in degrees.

arguments.name: SCALE=
arguments.description: specifies a scale factor for the marker symbol as a percentage.

arguments.name: VOFFSET=
arguments.description: specifies a vertical offset for the marker symbol.

statements.name: TEXT
statements.description: Displays the associated text values at (X, Y) locations in the graph. The text can be numbers or characters.

arguments.name: X=
arguments.description: specifies the variable for the X axis.

arguments.name: Y=
arguments.description: specifies the variable for the Y axis.

arguments.name: TEXT=
arguments.description: specifies the variable for the text values that are used for the markers.

arguments.name: ATTRID=
arguments.description: specifies the value of the ID variable in a discrete attribute map data set.

arguments.name: BACKFILL
arguments.description: displays filled bounding boxes around the text.

arguments.name: BACKLIGHT
arguments.description: specifies that the text should have a back light of a contrasting color.

arguments.name: CLUSTERAXIS=
arguments.description: specifies the axis to use for clustering groups when GROUPDISPLAY=CLUSTER.

arguments.name: CLUSTERWIDTH=
arguments.description: specifies the width of the group clusters as a fraction of the midpoint spacing.

arguments.name: COLORMODEL=
arguments.description: specifies a color ramp that is to be used to determine response colors.

arguments.name: style-element
arguments.description: specifies the name of a style element.

arguments.name: (color-list)
arguments.description: specifies a space-separated list of colors to use in the color ramp.

arguments.name: COLORRESPONSE=
arguments.description: specifies the numeric column that is used to map colors to a continuous color ramp.

arguments.name: CONTRIBUTEOFFSETS=
arguments.description: specifies whether this plot's space requirements contribute to the calculation of the axis offsets.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: the space requirements for this plot are contributed to the axis offset calculations.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: the space requirements for this plot are not contributed to the axis offset calculations.

arguments.name: (axis-offset-list)
arguments.description: a space-delimited list of specific contributions that this plot makes to the axis offset calculations.

arguments.name: DISCRETEOFFSET=
arguments.description: specifies an amount to offset all markers from discrete X or Y values.

arguments.name: FILLATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the fill color and transparency.

arguments.name: GROUP=
arguments.description: specifies a variable that is used to group the data.

arguments.name: GROUPDISPLAY=
arguments.description: specifies how to display grouped text markers.

arguments.name: CLUSTER
arguments.description: grouped items are drawn adjacent to each other.

arguments.name: OVERLAY
arguments.description: grouped items are drawn at the exact coordinate and might overlap.

arguments.name: LEGENDLABEL=
arguments.description: specifies a label that identifies the markers from the plot in the legend.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: assigns a name to a plot statement.

arguments.name: NOMISSINGGROUP
arguments.description: specifies that missing values of the group variable are not included in the plot.

arguments.name: OUTLINE
arguments.description: displays outlined bounding boxes around the text.

arguments.name: OUTLINEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the color of the outlines around the text boxes.

arguments.name: PAD=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of extra space that is added inside the text-marker border.

arguments.name: dimension
arguments.description: specifies a dimension to use for the extra space at the left, right, top, and bottom of the text-marker border.

arguments.name: (pad-options)
arguments.description: specifies a space-separated list of one or more pad options enclosed in parentheses.

arguments.name: POSITION=
arguments.description: specifies the position of the text with respect to the location of the data point.

arguments.name: RATTRID=
arguments.description: specifies the value of the ID variable in a range attribute map data set.

arguments.name: ROTATE=
arguments.description: specifies the angle of rotation in degrees for the text markers.

arguments.name: SIZEMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum font size for the largest text marker when a response variable is used to size the text-marker font.

arguments.name: SIZEMAXRESPONSE=
arguments.description: specifies the response value that corresponds to the maximum font size for text markers.

arguments.name: SIZEMIN=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum font size for text markers when a response variable is used to size the font for text values.

arguments.name: SIZERESPONSE=
arguments.description: specifies a response variable that is used to determine the font size for each text value.

arguments.name: SPLITCHAR=
arguments.description: specifies one or more characters on which the text is always split.

arguments.name: SPLITCHARNODROP
arguments.description: specifies that the split characters are included in the displayed value.

arguments.name: SPLITJUSTIFY=
arguments.description: specifies the horizontal alignment of the value text that is being split.

arguments.name: SPLITPOLICY=
arguments.description: specifies a policy for avoiding collisions among the text markers.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: does not split the text for text markers that collide.

arguments.name: SPLIT
arguments.description: splits the marker text at a split character only if a split is needed at that character in order to make the text fit the available space.

arguments.name: SPLITALWAYS
arguments.description: splits the marker text at every occurrence of a split character.

arguments.name: SPLITWIDTH=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum width of each split line, expressed as a character count.

arguments.name: STRIP
arguments.description: specifies that leading and trailing blanks should be stripped from the marker text before it is displayed.

arguments.name: TEXTATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the color and font properties of the marker text.

arguments.name: TIP=
arguments.description: specifies the data tip information to be displayed when the cursor is positioned over the graphics element.

arguments.name: (variable-list)
arguments.description: a space-separated list of variables enclosed in parentheses.

arguments.description: suppresses the data tips from this plot.

statements.name: VBAR
statements.description: Creates a vertical bar chart that summarizes the values of a category variable.

arguments.name: category-variable
arguments.description: specifies the variable whose values determine the categories of data represented by the bars.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies the confidence level for the confidence limits.

arguments.name: ATTRID=
arguments.description: specifies the value of the ID variable in a discrete attribute map data set.

arguments.name: BARWIDTH=
arguments.description: specifies the width of the bars as a ratio of the maximum possible width.

arguments.name: BASELINE=
arguments.description: specifies the response axis intercept for the baseline.

arguments.name: BASELINEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the baseline.

arguments.name: CATEGORYORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the order in which the categories are arranged.

arguments.name: RESPASC
arguments.description: sorts by the response values in ascending order.

arguments.name: RESPDESC
arguments.description: sorts by the response values in descending order.

arguments.name: CLUSTERWIDTH=
arguments.description: specifies the cluster width as a ratio of the maximum width.

arguments.name: COLORMODEL=
arguments.description: specifies a color ramp that is to be used to determine response colors.

arguments.description: specifies the name of a style element.

arguments.name: (color-list)
arguments.description: specifies a space-separated list of colors to use in the color ramp.

arguments.name: COLORRESPONSE=
arguments.description: specifies the numeric column that is used to map colors to a continuous color ramp.

arguments.name: COLORSTAT=
arguments.description: specifies the statistic to use for computing the response colors.

arguments.name: FREQ
arguments.description: frequency count

arguments.name: PCT
arguments.description: percentages between 0 and 100

arguments.name: SUM
arguments.description: sum values for the color response

arguments.name: MEAN
arguments.description: mean values for the color response

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: median values for the color response

arguments.name: DATALABEL
arguments.description: displays a label for each bar.

arguments.name: DATALABEL=
arguments.description: displays a label for each bar.

arguments.name: DATALABELATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the labels in the plot when you use the DATALABEL= option.

arguments.name: DATALABELFITPOLICY=
arguments.description: specifies a policy for avoiding collisions among the bar labels when bar labels are displayed and DATALABELPOS= is DATA.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: does not rotate the bar labels.

arguments.name: ROTATE
arguments.description: rotates the text 90 degrees, but only if collisions occur.

arguments.name: SPLIT
arguments.description: splits the labels at the character or characters specified in the SPLITCHAR= option.

arguments.name: SPLITALWAYS
arguments.description: always splits the values at the character or characters specified in the SPLITCHAR= option.

arguments.name: DATALABELPOS=
arguments.description: specifies the location of the data label.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: places the label on the data primitives (at the upper boundary of the bars).

arguments.name: BOTTOM
arguments.description: places the label below the bars on the bottom edge of the data area.

arguments.name: TOP
arguments.description: places the label above the bars on the top edge of the data area.

arguments.name: DATASKIN=
arguments.description: specifies a special effect to be used on the plot.
arguments.help: DATASKIN=NONE | CRISP | GLOSS | MATTE | PRESSED | SHEEN

arguments.name: DISCRETEOFFSET=
arguments.description: specifies an amount to offset all bars from the category midpoints.

arguments.name: DISPLAYBASELINE=
arguments.description: specifies whether the baseline is displayed.

arguments.name: AUTO
arguments.description: displays the baseline if the baseline intercept is within the response-axis range, excluding the minimum and maximum axis values.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: always displays the baseline.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: hides the baseline.

arguments.name: FILL
arguments.description: specifies whether the bars are filled.

arguments.name: NOFILL
arguments.description: specifies whether the bars are filled.

arguments.name: FILLATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the fill color and transparency.

arguments.name: FILLENDCOLOR=
arguments.description: specifies a fill color that is applied to the chart at the baseline.

arguments.name: FILLPATTERN
arguments.description: enables the display of line fill patterns for the plot.

arguments.name: FILLPATTERNATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the line-fill color and pattern.

arguments.name: style-element
arguments.description: specifies the name of a style element.

arguments.name: COLOR=
arguments.description: specifies a color to use for the fill lines.

arguments.name: PATTERN=
arguments.description: specifies the type of line pattern to use for the fill.

arguments.name: FILLTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the fill type that is applied to the chart.

arguments.name: SOLID
arguments.description: each bar is filled with the color that is assigned to the bar fill area.

arguments.name: GRADIENT
arguments.description: displays the color from the applied style at the end of the bar gradually changing to the color of the wall at the baseline of the bar.

arguments.name: ALPHAGRADIENT
arguments.description: a gradient is used to determine the fill color.

arguments.name: FREQ=
arguments.description: specifies a variable for the frequency count for each observation in the input data.

arguments.name: GROUP=
arguments.description: specifies a variable that is used to group the data.

arguments.name: GROUPDISPLAY=
arguments.description: specifies how to display grouped bars.

arguments.name: STACK
arguments.description: groups are overlaid without any clustering.

arguments.name: CLUSTER
arguments.description: displays group values as separate adjacent bars that replace the single category bar.

arguments.name: GROUPORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the ordering of the groups within a category.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: orders the groups within a category in data order of the group variable.

arguments.name: REVERSEDATA
arguments.description: orders the groups within a category in the reverse data order of the group variable.

arguments.name: ASCENDING
arguments.description: orders the groups within a category in ascending order of the group variable.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: orders the groups within a category in descending order of the group variable.

arguments.description: specifies the thickness of the bars when the category data is numeric.

arguments.name: LEGENDLABEL=
arguments.description: specifies the label that identifies the bar chart in the legend.

arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the limit lines in the plot.

arguments.description: specifies a positive number to use as a multiplier for changing the default width of the limit-bar cap (serif).

arguments.name: LIMITS=
arguments.description: specifies which limit lines to display.

arguments.name: BOTH
arguments.description: adds lower and upper limit lines to the plot.

arguments.name: LOWER
arguments.description: adds lower limit lines to the plot.

arguments.name: UPPER
arguments.description: adds upper limit lines to the plot.

arguments.description: specifies the statistic for the limit lines.

arguments.name: CLM
arguments.description: confidence limits

arguments.description: standard deviation

arguments.description: standard error

arguments.description: assigns a name to a plot statement.

arguments.name: NOZEROBARS
arguments.description: suppresses zero-length bars.

arguments.description: specifies the number of standard units for the limit lines, when you specify LIMITSTAT=STDDEV or LIMITSTAT=STDERR.

arguments.description: specifies whether the bars have outlines.

arguments.name: NOOUTLINE
arguments.description: specifies whether the bars have outlines.

arguments.name: OUTLINEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the bar outlines.

arguments.name: RATTRID=
arguments.description: specifies the value of the ID variable in a range attribute map data set.

arguments.name: RESPONSE=
arguments.description: specifies a numeric response variable for the plot.

arguments.name: SEGLABEL
arguments.description: displays a label inside each segment of a stacked bar.

arguments.description: specifies the text properties of the bar segment label text.

arguments.description: specifies a policy for fitting the bar segment labels within the bar segments.

arguments.description: no attempt is made to fit each segment label within its bar.

arguments.name: NOCLIP
arguments.description: does not clip bar segment labels that extend beyond the plot area.

arguments.description: drops any bar segment label that does not fit within its segment.

arguments.name: SEGLABELFORMAT=

arguments.name: SPLITCHARNODROP
arguments.description: specifies that the split characters are included in the displayed value.

arguments.help: DATASKIN=NONE | CRISP | GLOSS | MATTE | PRESSED | SHEEN

arguments.name: FILL
arguments.description: specifies whether the bars are filled.

arguments.name: NOFILL
arguments.description: specifies whether the bars are filled.

arguments.name: FILLATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the fill color and transparency of the transaction bars.

arguments.name: FINALBARATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the final bar.

arguments.name: FINALBARTICKVALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the tick value used on the X axis for the final bar, if displayed.

arguments.name: INITIALBARATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the initial bar, if displayed.

arguments.name: INITIALBARTICKVALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the tick value used on the X axis for the initial bar, if displayed.

arguments.name: INITIALBARVALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the value of the initial bar.

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: accepts a missing value as a valid category value.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: assigns a name to a plot statement.

arguments.name: OUTLINE
arguments.description: specifies whether the bars have outlines.

arguments.name: NOOUTLINE
arguments.description: specifies whether the bars have outlines.

arguments.name: RATTRID=
arguments.description: specifies the value of the ID variable in a range attribute map data set.

arguments.name: STAT=
arguments.description: specifies the statistic for the response axis.

arguments.name: MEAN
arguments.description: the mean of the response variable.

arguments.name: SUM
arguments.description: the sum of the response variable.

arguments.name: TIP=
arguments.description: specifies the data tip information to be displayed when the cursor is positioned over the graphics element.

arguments.name: (variable-list)
arguments.description: a space-separated list of variables enclosed in parentheses.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: suppresses the data tips from this plot.

arguments.name: TIPFORMAT=
arguments.description: applies formats to the list of data tip variables that you specify in the TIP= option.

arguments.name: TIPLABEL=
arguments.description: applies labels to the list of data tip variables that you specify in the TIP= option.

arguments.name: TRANSPARENCY=
arguments.description: specifies the degree of transparency for the plot.

arguments.name: URL=
arguments.description: specifies an HTML page to be displayed when parts of the plot are selected.

arguments.name: character-variable
arguments.description: specifies a variable that contains a valid HTML page reference (HREF) for each plot element that is to have an active link.

arguments.name: X2AXIS
arguments.description: assigns the variables that are assigned to the primary (bottom) horizontal axis to the secondary (top) horizontal axis.

arguments.name: Y2AXIS
arguments.description: assigns the variables that are assigned to the primary (left) vertical axis to the secondary (right) vertical axis.

statements.name: XAXIS
statements.description: Specifies the axis options for the X axis. You can control the features of the axis (for example, the axis label, grid lines, and minor tick marks). You can also control the structure of the axis (for example, the data range, data type, and tick mark values).

arguments.name: COLORBANDS=
arguments.description: specifies the display of alternating wall-color bands corresponding to the discrete axis bins.

arguments.name: COLORBANDSATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the fill appearance of the color band.

arguments.name: DISCRETEORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the order in which discrete tick values are placed on the axis. This option affects any plot with a discrete axis.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: places the values in the order in which they appear in the data.

arguments.name: FORMATTED
arguments.description: sorts the formatted values in ascending character order.

arguments.name: UNFORMATTED
arguments.description: sorts the unformatted values in ascending character order.

arguments.name: DISPLAY=
arguments.description: specifies which features of the axis are displayed.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: displays all of the features of the axis.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that none of the features of the axis are displayed.

arguments.name: NOLABEL
arguments.description: hides the axis label

arguments.name: NOLINE
arguments.description: hides the axis line

arguments.name: NOTICKS
arguments.description: hides the tick marks on the axis

arguments.name: NOVALUES
arguments.description: hides the tick mark values on the axis

arguments.name: FITPOLICY=
arguments.description: specifies the method that is used to fit tick mark values on a horizontal axis when there is not enough room to draw them normally.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: does not split the values.

arguments.name: ROTATE
arguments.description: rotates the value text 45 degrees.

arguments.name: ROTATETHIN
arguments.description: attempts to use ROTATE, and then THIN to fit the values.

arguments.name: SPLIT
arguments.description: splits the values at the character or characters specified in the SPLITCHAR= option.

arguments.name: SPLITALWAYS
arguments.description: always splits the values at the character or characters specified in the SPLITCHAR= option. If the value does not contain any of the specified split characters, a split does not occur.

arguments.name: SPLITROTATE
arguments.description: attempts to use SPLIT, and then ROTATE to fit the values.

arguments.name: STACKEDALWAYS
arguments.description: stacks the values vertically regardless of tick value collision.

arguments.name: STACKEDALWAYSTHIN
arguments.description: stacks the values vertically regardless of tick value collision.

arguments.name: STAGGER
arguments.description: shifts the values up and down.

arguments.name: STAGGERROTATE
arguments.description: attempts to use STAGGER, and then ROTATE to fit the values.

arguments.name: STAGGERTHIN
arguments.description: attempts to use STAGGER, and then THIN to fit the values.

arguments.name: THIN
arguments.description: removes some of the values from the axis.

arguments.name: GRID
arguments.description: creates grid lines at each tick on the axis.

arguments.name: GRIDATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the grid lines.

arguments.name: INTEGER
arguments.description: specifies that only integers are used for tick mark values.

arguments.name: INTERVAL=
arguments.description: specifies the tick interval for a time axis.

arguments.name: INTERVALMULT=
arguments.description: specifies a multiplier to apply to the time interval that is in effect for the axis.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: specifies a label for the axis.

arguments.name: LABELATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the axis labels.

arguments.name: LABELPOS=
arguments.description: specifies the position of the axis label.

arguments.name: CENTER
arguments.description: centers the axis label in the axis area (including any offsets).

arguments.name: DATACENTER
arguments.description: centers the axis label in the axis tick display area (excluding any offsets).

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: positions the label to the left of the axis area.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: positions the label to the right of the axis area.

arguments.name: LOGBASE=
arguments.description: specifies the base value for the logarithmic scale.

arguments.name: LOGSTYLE=
arguments.description: specifies how to scale and format the values for the major tick marks for logarithmic axes.

arguments.name: LOGEXPAND
arguments.description: places the tick marks at integer powers of the base.

arguments.name: LOGEXPONENT
arguments.description: places the tick marks at integer powers of the base, but identifies the values by the exponent.

arguments.name: LINEAR
arguments.description: places the tick marks at uniform linear intervals, but spaces them logarithmically.

arguments.name: LOGVTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the scale that is used when interpreting the values in the VALUES option and the MIN and MAX options.

arguments.name: EXPANDED
arguments.description: the values are interpreted as integer powers of the base (decimal numbers).

arguments.name: EXPONENT
arguments.description: the values are interpreted as integer exponents of the base.

arguments.name: MAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum data value to include in the display (the value might be adjusted by the threshold calculation).

arguments.name: MIN=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum data value to include in the display (the value might be adjusted by the threshold calculation).

arguments.name: MINOR
arguments.description: adds minor tick marks to a linear, log, or time axis.

arguments.name: MINORCOUNT=
arguments.description: specifies the number of minor tick marks for the axis.

arguments.name: MINORGRID
arguments.description: creates grid lines at each minor tick on the axis.

arguments.name: MINORGRIDATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the minor grid lines.

arguments.name: MINORINTERVAL=
arguments.description: specifies the time interval between minor ticks.

arguments.name: NOTIMESPLIT
arguments.description: prevents a time axis from splitting the time, date, or datetime values into two rows.

arguments.name: OFFSETMAX=
arguments.description: specifies an offset that follows the highest data value on the axis.

arguments.name: OFFSETMIN=
arguments.description: specifies an offset that precedes the lowest data value on the axis.

arguments.name: RANGES=
arguments.description: specifies the ranges for a broken axis.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: specifies the start of a range.

arguments.name: end
arguments.description: specifies the end of a range.

arguments.name: REFTICKS
arguments.description: adds tick marks to the axis that is opposite from the specified axis.

arguments.name: REFTICKS=
arguments.description: adds tick marks to the axis that is opposite from the specified axis.

arguments.name: LABEL
arguments.description: in addition to the tick marks, displays the axis label.

arguments.name: NOTICKS
arguments.description: suppresses the tick marks.

arguments.name: VALUES
arguments.description: in addition to the tick marks, displays the values that are represented by the tick marks.

arguments.name: REVERSE
arguments.description: specifies that the tick values are displayed in reverse (descending) order.

arguments.name: SPLITCHAR=
arguments.description: splits the text for tick mark values at the specified character or characters according to the fit policy that is in effect.

arguments.name: SPLITCHARNODROP
arguments.description: specifies that the split characters are included in the displayed value.

arguments.name: SPLITJUSTIFY=
arguments.description: specifies the horizontal alignment of the value text that is being split.

arguments.name: THRESHOLDMAX=
arguments.description: Specifies a threshold for displaying one more tick mark at the high end of the axis.

arguments.name: THRESHOLDMIN=
arguments.description: Specifies a threshold for displaying one more tick mark at the low end of the axis.

arguments.name: TICKSTYLE=
arguments.description: specifies the placement of the major tick marks in relation to the axis line.

arguments.name: OUTSIDE
arguments.description: displays the major tick marks outside of the axis frame.

arguments.name: INSIDE
arguments.description: displays the major tick marks inside the axis frame.

arguments.name: ACROSS
arguments.description: displays the major tick marks across the axis line.

arguments.name: INBETWEEN
arguments.description: displays the major tick marks between the discrete data values and outside of the axis frame.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of axis.

arguments.name: DISCRETE
arguments.description: specifies an axis with discrete values.

arguments.name: LINEAR
arguments.description: specifies a linear scale for the axis.

arguments.name: LOG
arguments.description: specifies a logarithmic scale for the axis.

arguments.name: TIME
arguments.description: specifies a time scale for the axis.

arguments.name: VALUEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the axis tick value labels.

arguments.name: VALUES=
arguments.description: specifies the values for the ticks on an axis.

arguments.name: values-list
arguments.description: specifies tick values for linear, time, and logarithmic axes.

arguments.name: "string-list"
arguments.description: specifies a space-separated list of string values enclosed in parentheses for a discrete axis.

arguments.name: VALUESDISPLAY=
arguments.description: specifies the text that is to be displayed for the tick values that are defined in the VALUES= option.

arguments.name: VALUESFORMAT=
arguments.description: specifies how to format the values for major tick marks.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: uses the format that has been assigned to the column that is contributing to the axis (or BEST6 if no format is assigned) in order to control the formatting of the major tick values.

arguments.name: SAS-format
arguments.description: specifies a format to apply to the major tick values.

arguments.name: VALUESHINT
arguments.description: specifies that the minimum and maximum axis values are determined independently of the values that you specify in the VALUES= option.

arguments.name: VALUESROTATE=
arguments.description: specifies how the tick values are rotated on the axis.

arguments.name: DIAGONAL
arguments.description: rotates the tick values diagonally.

arguments.name: DIAGONAL2
arguments.description: rotates the tick values to a reverse diagonal angle.

arguments.name: VERTICAL
arguments.description: rotates the tick values vertically.

statements.name: XAXISTABLE
statements.description: Creates a basic plot that displays data values at specific locations along the horizontal axis. The data values can be placed inside or outside of the axis. The SGPLOT procedure can contain multiple axis table statements.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies one or more variables for the axis table.

arguments.name: ATTRID=
arguments.description: specifies the value of the ID variable in a discrete attribute map data set.

arguments.name: CLASS=
arguments.description: creates a separate axis table for each unique value of the specified variable.

arguments.name: CLASSDISPLAY=
arguments.description: specifies how the class values are displayed.

arguments.name: STACK
arguments.description: displays the class values vertically at each midpoint value on the X axis.

arguments.name: CLUSTER
arguments.description: displays the class values horizontally at each midpoint value on the X axis.

arguments.name: CLASSORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the order in which the class values are displayed.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: displays the class values in the order in which they occur in the data.

arguments.name: REVERSEDATA
arguments.description: displays the class values in the reverse order from which they occur in the data.

arguments.name: ASCENDING
arguments.description: displays the class values in ascending order.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: displays the class values in descending order.

arguments.name: COLORGROUP=
arguments.description: specifies a variable that is used to determine the color of the table values.

arguments.name: DROPONMISSING
arguments.description: specifies that the entire axis table is dropped when all of the values are missing.

arguments.name: LABEL
arguments.description: specifies whether the table label is shown or hidden.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: specifies whether the table label is shown or hidden.

arguments.name: NOLABEL
arguments.description: specifies whether the table label is shown or hidden.

arguments.name: LABELATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the color and font attributes of the axis table label.

arguments.name: LABELPOS=
arguments.description: specifies the position of the labels at the left or right side of the axis table.

arguments.name: LOCATION=
arguments.description: specifies whether the axis table is placed outside or inside the axis area.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: assigns a name to a plot statement.

arguments.name: NOMISSINGCHAR
arguments.description: suppresses the display of the MISSING character (.) for missing numeric values.

arguments.name: NOMISSINGCLASS
arguments.description: specifies that missing values of the class variable are not included in the table.

arguments.name: PAD=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of extra space that is added inside the table border.

arguments.name: numeric-valueunits
arguments.description: specifies a dimension to use for the extra space at the table border.

arguments.name: TOP=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of extra space added to the top.

arguments.name: BOTTOM=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of extra space added to the bottom.

arguments.name: POSITION=
arguments.description: specifies the position of the axis table at the bottom or top of the graph.

arguments.name: SEPARATOR
arguments.description: creates a separating line between the axis table or axis tables and the plot.

arguments.name: STAT=
arguments.description: specifies the statistic for the axis table.

arguments.name: FREQ
arguments.description: the frequency of the axis table variable.

arguments.name: MEAN
arguments.description: the mean of the axis table variable.

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: the median of the axis table variable.

arguments.name: PERCENT
arguments.description: the percentage of the sum of the axis table variable.

arguments.name: SUM
arguments.description: the sum of the axis table variable.

arguments.name: STATLABEL
arguments.description: specifies whether the variable statistic is displayed in the table’s label.

arguments.name: NOSTATLABEL
arguments.description: specifies whether the variable statistic is displayed in the table’s label.

arguments.name: TEXTGROUP=
arguments.description: specifies the group variable that is used in a discrete attribute map data set to map text attributes to values for each observation.

arguments.name: TEXTGROUPID=
arguments.description: specifies an attribute ID for the TEXTGROUP= option.

arguments.name: TITLE=
arguments.description: specifies a title for the axis table.

arguments.name: TITLEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the title for the axis table.

arguments.name: VALUEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the axis table values.

arguments.name: X=
arguments.description: Specifies the X variable to use to align the table values to the X or X2 axis.

arguments.name: X2AXIS
arguments.description: assigns the table to the secondary (top) horizontal axis.

arguments.description: specifies a multiplier to apply to the time interval that is in effect for the axis.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: specifies a label for the axis.

arguments.name: LABELATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the axis labels.

arguments.name: LABELPOS=
arguments.description: specifies the position of the axis label.

arguments.name: BOTTOM
arguments.description: positions the label at the bottom of the axis area.

arguments.name: CENTER
arguments.description: centers the axis label in the axis area (including any offsets).

arguments.name: DATACENTER
arguments.description: centers the axis label in the axis tick display area (excluding any offsets).

arguments.name: TOP
arguments.description: positions the label at the top of the axis area.

arguments.name: LOGBASE=
arguments.description: specifies the base value for the logarithmic scale.

arguments.name: LOGSTYLE=
arguments.description: specifies how to scale and format the values for the major tick marks for logarithmic axes.

arguments.name: LOGEXPAND
arguments.description: places the tick marks at integer powers of the base.

arguments.name: LOGEXPONENT
arguments.description: places the tick marks at integer powers of the base, but identifies the values by the exponent.

arguments.name: LINEAR
arguments.description: places the tick marks at uniform linear intervals, but spaces them logarithmically.

arguments.name: LOGVTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the scale that is used when interpreting the values in the VALUES option and the MIN and MAX options.

arguments.name: EXPANDED
arguments.description: the values are interpreted as integer powers of the base (decimal numbers).

arguments.name: EXPONENT
arguments.description: the values are interpreted as integer exponents of the base.

arguments.name: MAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum data value to include in the display (the value might be adjusted by the threshold calculation).

arguments.name: MIN=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum data value to include in the display (the value might be adjusted by the threshold calculation).

arguments.name: MINOR
arguments.description: adds minor tick marks to a linear, log, or time axis.

arguments.name: MINORCOUNT=
arguments.description: specifies the number of minor tick marks for the axis.

arguments.name: MINORGRID
arguments.description: creates grid lines at each minor tick on the axis.

arguments.name: MINORGRIDATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the minor grid lines.

arguments.name: MINORINTERVAL=
arguments.description: specifies the time interval between minor ticks.

arguments.name: NOTIMESPLIT
arguments.description: prevents a time axis from splitting the time, date, or datetime values into two rows.

arguments.name: OFFSETMAX=
arguments.description: specifies an offset that follows the highest data value on the axis.

arguments.name: OFFSETMIN=
arguments.description: specifies an offset that precedes the lowest data value on the axis.

arguments.name: RANGES=
arguments.description: specifies the ranges for a broken axis.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: specifies the start of a range.

arguments.name: end
arguments.description: specifies the end of a range.

arguments.name: REFTICKS
arguments.description: adds tick marks to the axis that is opposite from the specified axis.

arguments.name: REFTICKS=
arguments.description: adds tick marks to the axis that is opposite from the specified axis.

arguments.name: LABEL
arguments.description: in addition to the tick marks, displays the axis label.

arguments.name: NOTICKS
arguments.description: suppresses the tick marks.

arguments.name: VALUES
arguments.description: in addition to the tick marks, displays the values that are represented by the tick marks.

arguments.name: REVERSE
arguments.description: specifies that the tick values are displayed in reverse (descending) order.

arguments.name: SPLITCHAR=
arguments.description: splits the text for tick mark values at the specified character or characters according to the fit policy that is in effect.

arguments.name: SPLITCHARNODROP
arguments.description: specifies that the split characters are included in the displayed value.

arguments.name: SPLITJUSTIFY=
arguments.description: specifies the horizontal alignment of the value text that is being split.

arguments.name: THRESHOLDMAX=
arguments.description: Specifies a threshold for displaying one more tick mark at the high end of the axis.

arguments.name: THRESHOLDMIN=
arguments.description: Specifies a threshold for displaying one more tick mark at the low end of the axis.

arguments.name: TICKSTYLE=
arguments.description: specifies the placement of the major tick marks in relation to the axis line.

arguments.name: OUTSIDE
arguments.description: displays the major tick marks outside of the axis frame.

arguments.name: INSIDE
arguments.description: displays the major tick marks inside the axis frame.

arguments.name: ACROSS
arguments.description: displays the major tick marks across the axis line.

arguments.name: INBETWEEN
arguments.description: displays the major tick marks between the discrete data values and outside of the axis frame.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of axis.

arguments.name: DISCRETE
arguments.description: specifies an axis with discrete values.

arguments.name: LINEAR
arguments.description: specifies a linear scale for the axis.

arguments.name: LOG
arguments.description: specifies a logarithmic scale for the axis.

arguments.name: TIME
arguments.description: specifies a time scale for the axis.

arguments.name: VALUEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the axis tick value labels.

arguments.name: VALUES=
arguments.description: specifies the values for the ticks on an axis.

arguments.name: values-list
arguments.description: specifies tick values for linear, time, and logarithmic axes.

arguments.name: "string-list"
arguments.description: specifies a space-separated list of string values enclosed in parentheses for a discrete axis.

arguments.name: VALUESDISPLAY=
arguments.description: specifies the text that is to be displayed for the tick values that are defined in the VALUES= option.

arguments.name: VALUESFORMAT=
arguments.description: specifies how to format the values for major tick marks.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: uses the format that has been assigned to the column that is contributing to the axis (or BEST6 if no format is assigned) in order to control the formatting of the major tick values.

arguments.name: SAS-format
arguments.description: specifies a format to apply to the major tick values.

arguments.name: VALUESHALIGN=
arguments.description: specifies the horizontal alignment for all of the tick values that are displayed on the axis.

arguments.name: VALUESHINT
arguments.description: specifies that the minimum and maximum axis values are determined independently of the values that you specify in the VALUES= option.

statements.name: Y2AXIS
statements.description: Specifies the axis options for the Y2 axis, which is displayed on the right side of the graph. You can control the features of the axis (for example, the axis label, grid lines, and minor tick marks). You can also control the structure of the axis (for example, the data range, data type, and tick mark values).

arguments.name: COLORBANDS=
arguments.description: specifies the display of alternating wall-color bands corresponding to the discrete axis bins.

arguments.name: COLORBANDSATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the fill appearance of the color band.

arguments.name: DISCRETEORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the order in which discrete tick values are placed on the axis. This option affects any plot with a discrete axis.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: places the values in the order in which they appear in the data.

arguments.name: FORMATTED
arguments.description: sorts the formatted values in ascending character order.

arguments.name: UNFORMATTED
arguments.description: sorts the unformatted values in ascending character order.

arguments.name: DISPLAY=
arguments.description: specifies which features of the axis are displayed.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: displays all of the features of the axis.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that none of the features of the axis are displayed.

arguments.name: NOLABEL
arguments.description: hides the axis label

arguments.name: NOLINE
arguments.description: hides the axis line

arguments.name: NOTICKS
arguments.description: hides the tick marks on the axis

arguments.name: NOVALUES
arguments.description: hides the tick mark values on the axis

arguments.name: FITPOLICY=
arguments.description: specifies the method that is used to fit tick mark values on a vertical axis when there is not enough room to draw them normally.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: does not split the values.

arguments.name: SPLIT
arguments.description: splits the values at the character or characters specified in the SPLITCHAR= option.

arguments.name: SPLITALWAYS
arguments.description: always splits the values at the character or characters specified in the SPLITCHAR= option.

arguments.name: THIN
arguments.description: removes some of the values from the axis.

arguments.name: GRID
arguments.description: creates grid lines at each tick on the axis.

arguments.name: GRIDATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the grid lines.

arguments.name: INTEGER
arguments.description: specifies that only integers are used for tick mark values.
