statements.name: YAXISTABLE
statements.description: Creates a basic plot that displays data values at specific locations along the vertical axis. The data values can be placed inside or outside of the axis. The SGPLOT procedure can contain multiple axis table statements.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies one or more variables for the axis table.

arguments.name: ATTRID=
arguments.description: specifies the value of the ID variable in a discrete attribute map data set.

arguments.name: CLASS=
arguments.description: creates a separate axis table for each unique value of the specified variable.

arguments.name: CLASSDISPLAY=
arguments.description: specifies how the class values are displayed.

arguments.name: STACK
arguments.description: displays the class values horizontally at each midpoint value on the Y axis.

arguments.name: CLUSTER
arguments.description: displays the class values vertically at each midpoint value on the Y axis.

arguments.name: CLASSORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the order in which the class values are displayed.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: displays the class values in the order in which they occur in the data.

arguments.name: REVERSEDATA
arguments.description: displays the class values in the reverse order from which they occur in the data.

arguments.name: ASCENDING
arguments.description: displays the class values in ascending order.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: displays the class values in descending order.

arguments.name: COLORGROUP=
arguments.description: specifies a variable that is used to determine the color of the table values.

arguments.name: DROPONMISSING
arguments.description: specifies that the entire axis table is dropped when all of the values are missing.

arguments.name: INDENT=
arguments.description: specifies a value to be used with the INDENTWEIGHT= option to determine the indention for each text value.

arguments.name: INDENTWEIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the indention weight (multiplier) for each observation.

arguments.name: LABEL
arguments.description: specifies whether the table label is shown or hidden.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: specifies whether the table label is shown or hidden.

arguments.name: NOLABEL
arguments.description: specifies whether the table label is shown or hidden.

arguments.name: LABELATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the color and font attributes of the axis table label.

arguments.name: LABELHALIGN=
arguments.description: specifies the horizontal alignment of the column labels, when displayed.

arguments.name: LABELJUSTIFY=
arguments.description: specifies the justification of the labels.

arguments.name: LABELPOS=
arguments.description: specifies the position of the labels at the bottom or top of the axis table.

arguments.name: LOCATION=
arguments.description: specifies whether the axis table is placed outside or inside the axis area.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: assigns a name to a plot statement.

arguments.name: NOMISSINGCHAR
arguments.description: suppresses the display of the MISSING character (.) for missing numeric values.

arguments.name: NOMISSINGCLASS
arguments.description: specifies that missing values of the class variable are not included in the table.

arguments.name: PAD=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of extra space that is added inside the table border.

arguments.name: numeric-valueunits
arguments.description: specifies a dimension to use for the extra space at the table border.

arguments.name: LEFT=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of extra space added to the left side.

arguments.name: RIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of extra space added to the right side.

arguments.name: POSITION=
arguments.description: specifies the position of the axis table at the left or right side of the graph.

arguments.name: SEPARATOR
arguments.description: creates a separating line between the axis table or axis tables and the plot.

arguments.name: STAT=
arguments.description: specifies the statistic for the axis table.

arguments.name: FREQ
arguments.description: the frequency of the axis table variable.

arguments.name: MEAN
arguments.description: the mean of the axis table variable.

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: the median of the axis table variable.

arguments.name: PERCENT
arguments.description: the percentage of the sum of the axis table variable.

arguments.name: SUM
arguments.description: the sum of the axis table variable.

arguments.name: STATLABEL
arguments.description: specifies whether the variable statistic is displayed in the table’s label.

arguments.name: NOSTATLABEL
arguments.description: specifies whether the variable statistic is displayed in the table’s label.

arguments.name: TEXTGROUP=
arguments.description: specifies the group variable that is used in a discrete attribute map data set to map text attributes to values for each observation.

arguments.name: TEXTGROUPID=
arguments.description: specifies an attribute ID for the TEXTGROUP= option.

arguments.name: TITLE=
arguments.description: specifies a title for the axis table.

arguments.name: TITLEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the title for the axis table.

arguments.name: TITLEHALIGN=
arguments.description: specifies the horizontal alignment of the axis table title bounding box relative to the axis table width.

arguments.name: TITLEJUSTIFY=
arguments.description: specifies the justification of the lines of a multiline title in the title bounding box. The justification is relative to the axis table width.

arguments.name: VALUEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the axis table values.

arguments.name: VALUEHALIGN=
arguments.description: specifies the horizontal alignment of the axis table values relative to the column width in the table.

arguments.name: VALUEJUSTIFY=
arguments.description: specifies the justification of the axis table values relative to the column width in the table.

arguments.name: Y=
arguments.description: Specifies the variable to use to align the table values to the Y or Y2 axis.

arguments.name: Y2AXIS
arguments.description: assigns the table to the secondary vertical axis.

statements.name: ATTRIB
statements.description: Associates a format, informat, label, and length with one or more variables.

arguments.name: variable-list
arguments.description: names the variables that you want to associate with the attributes.

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: associates a format with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: INFORMAT=
arguments.description: associates an informat with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: associates a label with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: LENGTH=
arguments.description: specifies the length of variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: TRANSCODE=
arguments.description: specifies whether character variables can be transcoded. Use TRANSCODE=NO to suppress transcoding. Variables with TRANSCODE=NO are not returned.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Orders the output according to the BY groups.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the variable that the procedure uses to form BY groups. You can specify more than one variable. If you do not use the NOTSORTED option in the BY statement, then either the observations in the data set must be sorted by all the variables that you specify, or they must be indexed appropriately. Variables in a BY statement are called BY variables.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order. The observations are grouped in another way (for example, chronological order).

statements.name: FORMAT
statements.description: Associates formats with variables.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: names one or more variables for SAS to associate with a format. You must specify at least one variable.

arguments.name: format
arguments.description: specifies the format that is listed for writing the values of the variables.

arguments.name: DEFAULT=
arguments.description: specifies a temporary default format for displaying the values of variables that are not listed in the FORMAT statement. These default formats apply only to the current DATA step; they are not permanently associated with variables in the output data set.

statements.name: LABEL
statements.description: Assigns descriptive labels to variables.
statements.help:
Form 1: Creates a descriptive label for one or more variables.
LABEL  variable-1=’text-string’ < ...variable-n=’text-string>; 
Form 2: Removes the label from one or more variables.
LABEL  variable-1 = ' ' < ...variable-n=’ ‘>; | variable-1 = < ...variable-n= >

arguments.name: text-string
arguments.description: specifies a label of up to 256 bytes.
removes a label from a variable. Enclose a single blank space in quotation marks to remove an existing label. You can remove labels from multiple variables in a single LABEL statement:

statements.name: WHERE
statements.description: Subsets the input data set by specifying certain conditions that each observation must meet before it is available for processing.

arguments.name: where-expression
arguments.description: is an arithmetic or logical expression that generally consists of a sequence of operands and operators. For more information about where processing, see .
